revised_title: On the Universal Law of Attraction and Gravitation
tldr: The author, John Kinnersley Smythies, investigates the universal law of attraction, including gravitation, as a particular case of approximation. He deduces a general system of equations to determine the motion of any number of spheres based on the distance function and their masses and mutual distances. Smythies also explores the physical impossibility of an exact universal law and suggests a method of unlimited approximation for any unknown law.
